CatDescriptText: Katie Green, 2054 Bentley Drive was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 25, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think children should be given 'allowances' (money)? If so, for what reason or reasons (just to have spending money or for chores done around the home, etc.)?  Do you think that it helps or hinders the development of the youngster?" answer reads: "They should.  It should be given so that they will have spending change, and also will not be forced to go around begging others for nickels and dimes."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Katie Green wearing light colored short sleeved dress with lace underneath, and light colored cap, standing in front of C.A. Michel, Smithfield Street, Downtown
